page.title: 20LADIES DAY, NESTON
page.content: In the early days of this century the day would sometimes end in near riot, with policemen being called from neighbouring villages to help maintain order.These days Ladies Day is very peaceful.The children in the parade wear white dresses and carry staffs decorated with flowers to match their dresses.The procession walks through the village to the Parish Church where a service is held.The procession continues to Neston Cross to listen to the 'National Anthem' and 'Abide With Me'.The children retire to the Civic Hall for a celebration tea.The whole day is a very important part of Neston and people hope the day will still be celebrated a hundred years from now.
